alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Haralson; Heard; Paulding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 9:56PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Paulding, southern Haralson, Carroll and northwestern Heard Counties through 1030 PM EST... At 956 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Tallapoosa to near Ranburne to near Wedowee, and moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Buchanan, Villa Rica, Bremen, Temple, Tallapoosa, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Waco, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Bowdon Junction, Tyus, Roosterville, Clem, Frolona, Abilene, Draketown and John Tanner State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
